    • Constructor Detail

      • NeuralNet

        public NeuralNet​(IngressEdge[] i,
                 EgressEdge[] o)
        This constructor takes a user-constructed neural net. The only nodes required are ingress and egress edge arrays. All hidden nodes are manipulated by recursivly operating on the egress edges. The ingress edges are needed to set the input values.
        Parameters:
        i - Ingress edges.
        o - Egress edges.

      • NeuralNet

        public NeuralNet​(int innumber,
                 int outnumber,
                 int[] layerSizes,
                 boolean sc)
        This constructor automates the process of building a neural net. The number of input and outputs is specified. The layerSize is an array of layer sizes. An array of size 0 or null may be passed if no hidden units are desired. The boolean sc, if true, uses a ScaledHiddenNode instead of a HiddenNode for the hidden nodes. The difference is that a ScaledHiddenNode has one extra edge for input. The extra, scaling, edge can sometimes allow for better versatility in training but may also confuse the neural net in some instances. This is why the option of choices is given. Note the neural nets with scaled hidden nodes tend to have significantly longer training epoches.
        Parameters:
        innumber - the number of inputs.
        outnumber - the number of classes or outputs.
        layerSizes - an array of sizes for each hidden layer from the inputs to the outputs.
        sc - if true, ScaledHiddenNodes are used instead of HiddenNodes.

      • getWorst

        public TrainingInstance getWorst​(TrainingSet s,
                                 int nth)
        Find the training instance that does nth worst. That is, there are nth instance that perform more badly that the index of the instance returned.

        Note that getWorst(dataSet,1) is equivalent to getWorst(dataSet).

        Parameters:
        s - Training set.
        nth - Which of the worst training sets to get.
        Returns:
        The training set.

      • getWorst

        public TrainingInstance getWorst​(TrainingSet s)
        Return the training instance which we think is least well performed on.
        Parameters:
        s - The training set.
        Returns:
        The training instance which we think is the least well performed on.

      • stopTraining

        public void stopTraining()
        In an asynchronous environment it may be beneficial to be able to cause the train() method to stop and exit. This will set the field learn equal false which will cause train() to gracefully exit on its next iteration.

      • train

        public void train​(TrainingSet s,
                  int i)
        Training i times.
        Parameters:
        s - The training set.
        i - The number of iterations to train.

      • trainUp

        public double trainUp​(TrainingSet s)
        This is intended to be the generic training method for a NeuralNet. It trains the NeuralNet until any further training will decrease the accuracy.

        Training is done by calling train(TrainingSet s) repeatedly.

        Parameters:
        s - The training set.
        Returns:
        The accuracy after training.

      • train

        public double train​(TrainingSet s)
             throws TrainingException
        This method will train the neural net once given the TrainingSet s. Starting at the first TrainingInstance this will try to train that instance. If there is no loss in accuracy, that training is accepted and the method returns the current accuracy. If the first TrainingInstance decreases the accuracy, then the next instance is tried and so on until either the training set is exhausted or an instance is found which does not decrease the accuracy. If no TrainingInstance will not decrease accuracy, then a TrainingException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        s - The training set.
        Returns:
        The accuracy in percentage correct.
        Throws:
        TrainingException - When accuracy cannot be reached.

      • train

        public int train​(TrainingSet s,
                 double acc,
                 int n)
          throws TrainingException
        Train n times or until the accuracy is met. If the value of n is exceeded and the training level is not met, then a TrainingException is thrown. Returns the number of iterations actually taken to reach the accuracy.
        Parameters:
        s - The training set.
        acc - The accuracy we want.
        n - A limit on the number of training rounds to do.
        Returns:
        The number of iterations taken to converge.
        Throws:
        TrainingException - if more rounds than n are used and we do not reach the required accuracy.

      • train

        public void train​(TrainingSet s,
                  double acc)
        Traing until stopped (using stopTraining) or until the accuracy exceeds acc.
        Parameters:
        s - a set of training data.
        acc - lowerbound for accuracy.

      • copy

        public NeuralNet copy()
        This will make a copy of the NeurlaNet and ALL nodes and edges.

        Some times it is desirable to gate a snap shot of a Neural net as further training my worsen performance or perhaps two nets would like to be trained on seperate sets of data. This method is handy for JUST such a purpose!

        Returns:
        A copy of this NeuralNet.
